intro: Myrsine salicina, commonly known as the New Zealand myrsine, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, fleshy berries. Myrsine salicina is often found in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in moist, shaded environments.
